data.title: Top Current Affairs Quiz 14th November 2022
data.meta_description: All the important 14 November MCQ Current Affairs are available in this article so you should know about all the latest MCQ Current Affairs
data.text:
In this article, we will discuss all the important Current Affairs MCQs of 14 November with full explanations. Where we will discuss the daily current affairs quiz’s questions and answers. So read all the important 14 November MCQs carefully.

Current Affairs Quiz / 14 November MCQ Current Affairs

14 November Current Affairs MCQ – Questions

1. Who has been awarded 32nd Bihari Puraskar 2022 for his 2015 literary criticism book ‘Pachrang Chola Pahar Sakhi Ri’?

(a) Acharya Ramlochan Saran

(b) Kumar vansi

(c) Raman Prasad Sinha

(d) Dr. Madhav Hada

2. Which of the following state has observed 10th November 2022 as ‘Millet Day’ in the state?

(a) Odisha

(b) Bihar

(c) Rajasthan

(d) Uttar Pradesh

3. Who has been awarded 31st Bihari Puraskar 2021 for her 2018 novel ‘Hum Yahan The’?

(a) Tabish Khair

(b) Madhu Kankariya

(c) Amitava Kumar

(d) Gunjesh Bond

4. Which of the following has agreed to provide USD 4.5 billion in loans for Bangladesh to combat the economic crisis?

(a) World Bank

(b) Asian Development Bank

(c) AIIB

(d) IMF

5. Name the Father of modern election science, who passed away recently.

(a) Edwin Henderson

(b) Ebenezer Cobb Morley

(c) Charles William Miller

(d) Sir David Butler

6. What is the theme of National Education Day 2022?

(a) Changing Course, Transforming Education

(b) Education of women

(c) Compulsory universal primary education

(d) Free and fair education

7. Who has scripted history as he became the first batter in history to reach 4000 runs in T20 Internationals?

(a) Rohit Sharma

(b) Virat Kohli

(c) Martin Guptill

(d) Babar Azam

8. What is the theme of World Usability Day 2022?

(a) Human-Centered A.I.

(b) Design of Our Online World

(c) Design for the Future We Want

(d) Our Health

9. All India Rubber Industries Association (AIRIA) has announced that it has elected ______ as its president.

(a) Sanjay Kumar

(b) Ramesh Kejriwal

(c) Shankar Gola

(d) Jagdish Gupta

10. Which of the following team won the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy title at Eden Gardens, Kolkata?

(a) Himachal Pradesh

(b) Tamil Nadu

(c) Karnataka

(d) Mumbai

11. Who has won the men’s singles Paris Master’s 2022 title?

(a) Holger Rune

(b) Novak Djokovic

(c) Wesley Koolh

(d) Neal Skupski

12. Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) of NITI Aayog has launched the Women-centric challenges under the 2nd edition of the Atal New India Challenge (ANIC). Atal Innovation Mission was launched in which year?

(a) 2014

(b) 2015

(c) 2016

(d) 2017

13. National Education Day is observed annually on _______ in India.

(a) November 15

(b) November 14

(c) November 13

(d) November 11

14. India will host the women’s world boxing championships in 2023 in which of the following city?

(a) Bengaluru

(b) New Delhi

(c) Chennai

(d) Ahmedabad

15. World Usability Day is observed annually on which day?

(a) Second Monday of November

(b) Second Tuesday of November

(c) Second Wednesday of November

(d) Second Thursday of November

14 November MCQs – Answers

1. (d)

Dr. Madhav Hada was awarded the 32nd Bihari Puraskar. Hada was awarded for his 2015 literary criticism book ‘Pachrang Chola Pahar Sakhi Ri’.

2. (a)

The state government of Odisha is observing 10th November 2022 as ‘Millet Day’ in the state. The day is chosen according to the Hindu calendar, the 1st Thursday of margasira month.

3. (b)

Noted writer Madhu Kankariya was awarded the 31st Bihari Puraskar. Kankariya was awarded the Puraskar for her 2018 novel ‘Hum Yahan The’.

4. (d)

Bangladesh and the IMF reached a preliminary agreement under which the global lender will provide a USD 4.5 billion support package to stabilize its economy and protect vulnerable people.

5. (d)

Sir David Butler, dubbed the “father of election science”, has died at the age of 98. He was born on the 17th of October 1924, Butler became a diligent student of philosophy, politics, and economics at New College, Oxford.

6. (a)

This day is celebrated to acknowledge and honor Maulana Azad’s contribution to the country’s education system. The theme for National Education Day 2022 is “Changing Course, Transforming Education.”

7. (b)

Indian star cricketer, Virat Kohli has scripted history as he became the first batter in history to reach 4000 runs in T20 Internationals.

8. (d)

The theme of World Usability Day 2022 is “Our Health”. The theme for this year is to evaluate systems that provide healthcare in all of its various forms, such as virtual/telehealth, electronic health records, healthcare products, and all digital health-related solutions.

9. (b)

All India Rubber Industries Association (AIRIA) has announced that it has elected Ramesh Kejriwal as its president and Shashi Singh as the senior vice president.

10. (d)

Domestic giants Mumbai produced a near-perfect performance to beat Himachal Pradesh by three wickets in the final and won their maiden Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy title at Eden Gardens, Kolkata.

11. (a)

19-year-old Danish player Holger Rune has defeated the six-time champion, Novak Djokovic to clinch his first Men’s single, the 2022 Masters Title in Paris.

12. (c)

Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) is the Government of India’s flagship initiative to promote a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship in the country and was set up in 2016.

13. (d)

National Education Day is observed annually on November 11 in India. In India, National Education Day is celebrated every year on November 11 as it marks the birth anniversary of Maulana Abul Kalam Azad, who was India’s first education minister after independence.

14. (b)

India will host the women’s world boxing championships in 2023 in New Delhi. It will be the third time that the women’s competition will be held in the country having conducted the championships in 2006 & 2018.

15. (d)

World Usability Day is observed annually on the second Thursday of November and this year is celebrated on November 10.
